data.text: I am the man that sees poverty,
He has taken me, and led me away into darkness,
Nay, against me has he turned his hand all the day.
He has made old my flesh and my skin;
He has built against me, and compassed my head,
He has set me in dark places,
He has built against me, and I cannot come forth:
Yea, though I cry and shout,
He has built up my ways,
He has troubled me,
He pursued me after I departed,
He has bent his bow,
He has caused the arrows of his quiver
I became a laughingstock to all my people;
He has filled me with bitterness,
And he has dashed out my teeth with gravel,
He has also removed my soul from peace:
Therefore my success has perished,
I remembered by reason of my poverty,
And my soul shall meditate with me.
This will I lay up in my heart,
It is the mercies of the Lord,
They are new every morning:
The Lord is my portion, says my soul;
The Lord is good to them that wait for him:
Is good, and shall wait for,
It is good for a man
He will sit alone, and be silent,
He will give his cheek to him that smites him:
For the Lord will not reject forever.
For he that has brought down will pity,
He has not answered in anger from his heart,
To bring down under his feet
To turn aside the judgment of a man
To condemn a man unjustly in his judgment,
Who has thus spoken, and it has come to pass?
Out of the mouth of the Most High
Why should a living man complain,
Our way has been searched out and examined,
Let us lift up our hearts with our hands
We have sinned,
Thou hast visited us in wrath,
Thou hast veiled thyself with a cloud
And be cast off.
All our enemies have opened their mouth against us.
Fear and wrath are come upon us,
Mine eye shall pour down torrents of water,
Mine eye is drowned with tears,
Until the Lord look down,
Mine eye shall prey upon my soul,
The fowlers chased me as a sparrow,
And laid a stone upon me.
Water flowed over my head:
I called upon thy name, O Lord,
Thou heardest my voice:
Thou drewest nigh to my help:
O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul;
Thou hast seen, O Lord, my troubles:
Thou hast seen all their vengeance,
Thou hast heard their reproach
The lips of them that rose up against me,
Their sitting down and their rising up:
Thou wilt render them a recompense, O Lord,
Thou wilt give them as a covering,
Thou wilt persecute them in anger,
